headerText: The `v-divider` component is used to separate sections of lists or layouts.

usage.desc: Dividers in their simplest form display a horizontal line.

inset.desc: Inset dividers are moved 72px to the right. This will cause them to line up with list items.

vertical.desc: Vertical dividers give you more tools for unique layouts.

vertical-inset.desc: Vertical dividers can also be paired with the `inset` prop for even more options.

subheaders.desc: Dividers and subheaders can help break up content and can optionally line up with one another by using the same `inset` prop.

divider-list-portrait.desc: Create custom cards to fit any use-case

accessibility.desc: By default, `v-divider` components are assigned the [WAI-ARIA](https://www.w3.org/WAI/standards-guidelines/aria/) role of [**separator**](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/#separator) which denotes that the divider "separates and distinguishes sections of content or groups of menuitems." However, sometimes a divider is just a way to make an interface look nice. In those cases, the role of [**presentation**](https://www.w3.org/TR/wai-aria/#presentation) should be used which denotes "an element whose implicit native role semantics will not be mapped to the accessibility API." To override the default **separator** role in a `v-divider`, simply add a `role="presentation"` prop to your component. In addition, `v-divider` components have an `aria-orientation="horizontal"`. If `vertical="true"`, then `aria-orientation="vertical"` will be set automatically as well. If `role="presentation"`, `aria-orientation="undefined"`, it's default value.

props.inset: Adds indentation (72px) for **normal** dividers, reduces max height for **vertical**.
